pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:4.1: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:5.1: 13. The training rule on talking out in the open
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:6.2: At that time a male relative of a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī went from his village to Sāvatthī on some business.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:6.4: knowing that the Master had prohibited standing or talking alone with a man in a concealed place, she instead stood and talked alone with that man out in the open.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:7.3: “How can a nun stand and talk alone with a man out in the open?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:7.7: How can a nun stand and talk alone with a man out in the open?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:8.1: ‘If a nun stands or talks alone with a man out in the open, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:10.2: not concealed by a wall, a door, a screen, a cloth screen, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:11.2: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:12.4: just the man and the nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:13.2: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:14.2: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:15.1: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:15.2: If she stands or talks with a spirit, a ghost, a eunuch, or an animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:16.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:17.1: The third training rule is finished.
